entry.title: 『Indie』ShoomShoom
entry.content:
Shoom Shoom

An independent game demo created by me and my friend オウシン(Chen Wang)

The game itself is still under development, we will strive to make a complete gaming experience.

We have created a complete world view and story framework for the game, and carefully designed characters, story, and gameplay. We hope you will enjoy it.

Click   Here   to play!

Or check the Github repo here  

The game is about a small mouse named Shoom Shoom, who lives in the underground city in a steampunk world.
He uses his homemade steam machinery and weapons to smuggle goods for customers in order to survive.

How to Play

You can use wd or ←→ to move left and right.
Use shift to run.
Use space to jump.

Project Structure

I use Unity3D as the game engine.
Also includes these functionalities:

  • URP
    To make the scene more beautiful.
    Add ShaderGraph to create special render effect(like the water and the shadow of water reflected on the wall behind)

  • UniRx
    Reactive state control.
    Script sequence control.

  • DoTween
    tween animation.
    For example the camera movement.

  • Cinemation
    Camera control.

  • Spine Unity Runtime
    For implement the spine animations I have created.

I also created the spine animations for shoom shoom and his enemies. (Will create more in the future…)

entry.title: 『Job』クリーク・アンド・リバー社
entry.content:
CREEK & RIVER Co., Ltd.

In 2022, I joined the Japanese entertainment company CREEK & RIVER, where I developed a variety of hyper-casual games.

Each title was produced end-to-end by myself—from the initial planning stage, through development, to the final release. During the planning phase, I worked under the guidance of a planner, but the full production and publishing process was carried out independently by me.

Merge Spear

Among all these games, I like the “Merge Spear” the most so I am going to give you some details about the game here.

In this game, players choose a suitable spearhead, combine it into a weapon, and then face off against enemies—kind of like a fighting game.

I enjoyed working on this project because the gameplay felt fresh and engaging, and I had a lot of fun implementing the different attack effects.

For the camera system, I didn’t rely on any plugins but instead wrote my own scripts, and I’m very satisfied with the result.

(Click ↑ to watch a demo video)

Technologies Used:

  • Engine & Language: Unity, C#
  • Graphics: Shader Graph, Particle System
  • 3D & Animation: Blender, Unity Animation
  • Version Control: Git

entry.title: 『Indie』Sleepy DaVinci Code
entry.content:
A DaVinci code board game.

Rule:
Reveal all of your opponent’s secret code before they crack yours!

(Click ↑ to watch a demo video)

Click   Here   to play!

Or check the Github repo here  

Project Structure

This is a game demo using

  • Frontend: Pixi.js, React (Next.js) and GSAP
  • Backend: Node, Express and Socket.io
  • DB: Redis as data cache
  • Construct and deploy: Docker, Nginx

For this game, I have designed the whole system, the art base and picked up the technologies I needed.

I have finished the programming part all by myself.

One of my friend has draw the most of the sprites for me. (A great thanks here)

For the demo server, I have bought a VPS from Linode and built a docker + nginx deploy flow. I was planed to use AWS or Google Cloud, however I found it is a little bit waste to deploy such a small project using them. Also I can learn more by using a brand new server out of box.

I am still working on improving the game. I hope you will enjoy it.

entry.title: 『Job』株式会社マンカインドゲームズ
entry.content:
Mankind Games Inc.

I worked here for around three years, during which I contributed to a wide range of projects, including AR applications, social apps, and games. My responsibilities covered
programming, technical art, and also serving as a project leader.

ぱちょふぁ そまちょぱ そまちょぱそ


This game is the very first mobile title based on the popular YouTube animation channel “Hajimemashite Matsuo desu”.

The game’s title comes from a famous nonsensical phrase in “Hajimemashite Matsuo desu.” For convenience, we refer to it simply as pachofa.

It is designed as a casual idle game where players can collect mushrooms during short play sessions and gradually evolve stars and civilizations. Every day, a new chick can also be obtained.

I was involved from the very beginning—taking part in the planning phase, building the program architecture, implementing gameplay systems, and even contributing to animation production.

(Here ↑ is the official game trailer)

In this project, I applied an MVC architecture design and implemented several custom UI features that I developed myself. Some of these features have been made publicly available in

this Git repository  

Technologies Used:

  • Engine & Language: Unity, C#
  • 3D & Animation: Spine, Unity Animation
  • Version Control: Git

結KYOTO


This app is a metaverse application that offers users the opportunity to virtually explore Kyoto together online.

For this project, I developed the avatar system (movement, customization, and animations), the online system (synchronization and communication), as well as the core project architecture.

Technologies Used:

  • Engine & Language: Unity, C#
  • Graphics: Shader Graph, Particle System
  • 3D & Animation: Unity Animation
  • Online: Photon, Vivox
  • Version Control: Git

Mirror Muse


“Mirror Muse” is an app that lets users create a 3D avatar from a single photo and transform it into their ideal self. Avatars can be customized with different outfits, hairstyles, poses, and decorations, making it easy to share unique creations on social media.

In this project, I was responsible for a wide range of features, including the outfit-changing system, tutorial flow, gacha mechanics, mini-games, and the communication lobby. Beyond feature development, I also took on project management and worked as the technical lead. Importantly, I contributed to both the client-side and server-side development, overseeing the full technical scope of the project.

Technologies Used:

  • Engine & Language: Unity, C#
  • Graphics: Shader Graph
  • 3D & Animation: Blender, Unity Animation
  • Cloud: Firebase (Realtime DB, Functions…)
  • Version Control: Git

Confidential Project With GungHo

The project is a collaboration with GungHo Online Entertainment, Inc. Since the title has not yet been released, details remain confidential.

It is a large-scale multiplayer online game developed with Unreal Engine. My responsibilities focused on the development of player actions and skill systems.

Technologies Used:

  • Engine & Language: UE, C++, BP
  • Version Control: Perforce

entry.title: 『Job』株式会社G-Blossom
entry.content:
G-Blossom Co., Ltd.

I joined G-Blossom Co., Ltd. because I wanted to work on developing more indie-style games.
However, after joining, my main responsibility was the development of a social game. Although this was different from what I originally expected, I gained valuable experience in online game development, as I was responsible for the entire process from front-end to back-end on my own.

拳極


The project I worked on was a game called Ken Goku (拳極). By the time I joined, the game had already been released and had been in live operation for quite some time. It is a combat-focused social game themed around Japanese yakuza culture. Players can progress through main story missions, recruit underlings, form alliances, engage in PvP, and purchase or upgrade equipment.

Here is the official site of the game: https://kengoku.com/

The game is heavily social, offering features such as chat, greetings, friend-making, sparring, gift-giving, and cooperative battles. In addition, it includes extensive in-app purchases and gacha systems, which made the backend implementation particularly complex.

(Here ↑ is the official game trailer)

I was responsible for full-stack development, covering both frontend and backend. My main tasks included bug fixing, feature updates, and maintaining seasonal operations.

Technical Details

In this project, we have used these tools for the development:

  • Communication
    • Slack
  • Task Management
    • Backlog
  • Client
    • Unity
  • Backend
    • AWS
      • Lambda （nodejs）
      • MySQL
      • DynamoDB
    • Firebase
  • CI/CD
    • UnityCloudBuild

Because the game’s architecture was also quite complex, I created a simple diagram to illustrate its structure.

The architecture connects a Unity client to AWS Lambda APIs, which interact with both RDS (MySQL) and DynamoDB.
The client can access DynamoDB in a one-way direction but cannot modify it.
Firebase is used to push notification to the client.
The client gets the Asset Bundle from S3.

There is also a CMS, where the management team can modify DB and S3 directly.

The system supports multiple environments (DEV/TEST/STG/PROD) for smooth development and live operations.
